intro: Encelia purpurea, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green foliage and showy, purple-pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Encelia purpurea typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats. It is adapted to drought conditions and thrives in full sun.
